mwr_raw2l1.readers.base_reader_rpg module

class mwr_raw2l1.readers.base_reader_rpg.BaseReader(filename, accept_localtime=False)

Bases: object

check_data()

general checks for the consistency of the data which can be applied to all file type readers

decode_binary(encoding_pattern, byte_order='<')

” decode next variables from binary stream and write to dict self.data + augment self.byte_offset :param encoding_pattern: a list of tuples or lists containing the individual variable description

e.g. [dict(name=’n_meas’, type=’i’, shape=(1,)),

dict(name=’timeref’, type=’i’, shape=(1,)), dict(name=’n_freq’, type=’i’, shape=(1,))]

decode_binary_np(encoding_pattern, n_entries, byte_order='<')

decode bunch of binary stream via 2d numpy array to write to dict self.data + augment self.byte_offset

Parameters

encoding_pattern –

a list of tuples or lists containing the individual variable description for one time step e.g. [dict(name=’time_raw’, type=’i’, shape=(1,)),

dict(name=’rainflag’, type=’B’, shape=(1,)), dict(name=’Tb’, type=’f’, shape=(n_freq,))]

interpret_filecode()

assign configuration for read in of file with corresponding file code

interpret_header()

interpret data read in with _read_header

interpret_raw_data()

interpret data read in with _read_meas (e.g. get ele/azi from pointing code or datetime from timecode)

read()

read and interpret all data in self.data_bin

run()

do whole read-in from files and interpretation and checking of data

mwr_raw2l1.readers.legacy_reader_rpg module

mwr_raw2l1.readers.legacy_reader_rpg.read_blb(filename, accept_localtime=False)

Read BLB file holding the MWR brightness temperatures of elevation scans

Parameters

  • filename (str) – path to *.blb file holding the scanning observations.

  • accept_localtime (bool, optional) – Accept that timestamp is stored in localtime. The default is False.

Returns

data – containts observations and metadata flag meanings:

rainflag: 0, no rain; 1, rain scanmode: 0, 1st quadrant; 1, 2nd quadrant;

2, two quadrant avg; 3, two independent scans

Return type

dict

mwr_raw2l1.readers.legacy_reader_rpg.read_brt(filename, accept_localtime=False)

Read BRT file holding the MWR brightness temperatures of starring obs (fixed azimuth and elevation)

Parameters

  • filename (str) – path to *.brt file holding the starring MWR brightness temp obs.

  • accept_localtime (bool, optional) – Accept that timestamp is stored in localtime. The default is False.

Returns

data – containts observations and metadata flag meanings:

rainflag: 0, no rain; 1, rain

Return type

dict

mwr_raw2l1.readers.legacy_reader_rpg.read_hkd(filename, accept_localtime=False)

Read HKD file holding the housekeeping data

Parameters

  • filename (str) – path to *.hkd file holding the housekeeping data.

  • accept_localtime (bool, optional) – Accept that timestamp is stored in localtime. The default is False.

Returns

data – containts observations and metadata flag meanings:

rainflag: 0, no rain; 1, rain

Return type

dict

mwr_raw2l1.readers.legacy_reader_rpg.read_irt(filename, accept_localtime=False)

Read IRT file holding the infrared brightness temperatures

Parameters

  • filename (str) – path to *.irt file holding the infrared observations.

  • accept_localtime (bool, optional) – Accept that timestamp is stored in localtime. The default is False.

Returns

mwr_raw2l1.readers.legacy_reader_rpg.read_met(filename, accept_localtime=False)

Read MET file holding the observations of the weather sensors

Parameters

  • filename (str) – path to *.met file holding the meteorological observations.

  • accept_localtime (bool, optional) – Accept that timestamp is stored in localtime. The default is False.

Returns

CARE: This procedure will not work for files as lv0 files which don’t have data headers on top of file

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg module

readers for the different binary files from RPG radiometers (HATPRO, TEMPRO or HUMPRO)

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg.main()
mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg.read_multiple_files(files)

read multiple L1-related files and return dictionary of executed read-in class instances

Parameters

files – list of files to read in

Returns

dictionary with keys brt, blb, irt, met, hkd containing list with all read-in class instances for the corresponding file extension matching basename and the timing requirement. If no file of the corresponding type is found an empty list is returned for this key.

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers module

helper functions for the module reader_rpg

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers.flag_int2bits(flag_integer)

transform an integer value to bits. Input can be time series or scalars

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers.interpret_angle(x, version)

translate the angle encoding from RPG to elevation and azimuth in degrees

Parameters

  • x (float) – RPG angle.

  • version (int) – version of RPG angle encoding: 1: sign(ele) * (abs(ele)+1000*azi) 2: digits 1-5 = elevation*100; digits 6-10 = azimuth*100

Returns

  • ele (float) – elevation

  • azi (float) – azimuth

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers.interpret_bit_order(bit_order)

interpret bit_order for use in numpy’s unpackbits so that it also ‘>’ and ‘<’ can be used

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers.interpret_coord(x, version=2)

Translate coordinate encoding from RPG to degrees with decimal digits.

Parameters

  • x (float) –

  • version (int) – version of RPG angle encoding: 1: latitude of lognitude in fomrat (-)DDDMM.mmmm where DDD is degrees, MM is minutes and mmmm is the decimal fraction of MM 2: latitude and longitude already in decimal degrees. function does nothing

Returns

out – latitude or longitude in format decimal degrees.

Return type

float

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers.interpret_hkd_contents_code(contents_code_integer)

interpret the integer contents code from HKD files and return dict of contents variables

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers.interpret_met_auxsens_code(auxsenscode)

interpret integer code for the availability of auxiliary sensors in MET files, return dict of contents vars

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers.interpret_quadrant_int(int_quadr)

helper function for interpret scanflag for interpreting 2nd and 3rd bit (as int). See documentation from there

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers.interpret_scanflag(flag_integer)

interpret flag of BLB scan

first bit: rainflag

2nd/3rd bit (input) | scan_quadrant (output) | description ——————–|------------------------|——————- 0/0 | 1 | first quadrant 0/1 | 2 | second quadrant 1/0 | 0 | average over both quadrants

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers.interpret_statusflag(flag_integer)

interpret the statusflag from HKD files and return a dict of status variables (input time series or scalar)

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers.interpret_time(time_in)

translate the time format of RPG files to datetime object

mwr_raw2l1.readers.reader_rpg_helpers.interpret_tstab_flag(flag)

interpret temperature stability flag and return a flag saying stability ok (1), not ok (0) or unknown (NaN)

tstab flag (input) | tstab ok (output) | description ——————-|-------------------|——————- 0 | NaN | unknown stability (too short measurement series available) 1 | 1 | stability ok 2 | 0 | not ok (T sensors differ by >0.3 K)
